expressions.example: I've been on cloud nine since I got the job.
She's over the moon about her promotion.
He's been down in the dumps lately.
I'm feeling under the weather today.
I'm completely burned out from work.
I've been on edge all week.
I'm at my wits' end trying to solve this.
She was beside herself with joy.
I have butterflies in my stomach before interviews.
I've been walking on air since I met her.
expressions.translation: 그녀를 만난 이후로 기분이 날아갈 것 같아요.

expressions.example: I tried to keep my cool during the argument.
I go jogging to **blow off steam**.
I got cold feet before the presentation.
I arrived **in the nick of time**.
I visit my parents **from time to time**.
I eat fast food **once in a blue moon**.

expressions.expression: at the drop of a hat
expressions.example: She'll help you **at the drop of a hat**.
I like to arrive **ahead of time**.
**It's high time** we made a decision.
Good design stands the test of time.
expressions.translation: 좋은 디자인은 오랜 시간이 지나도 유효해요.

expressions.example: **At this point in time**, I'm not sure.
It will be beneficial **in the long run**.
She always goes the extra mile for customers.
expressions.translation: 그녀는 항상 고객을 위해 더 노력해요.

expressions.example: We need to **think outside the box**.
Let's **get the ball rolling** on this project.
Everyone needs to pull their weight.
It took me a month to **learn the ropes**.
expressions.translation: 요령을 익히는 데 한 달이 걸렸어요.

expressions.example: We need to **be on the same page**.
They raised the bar for quality.
I **hit the ground running** on my first day.
**The bottom line** is we need more time.
expressions.translation: 결론은 더 많은 시간이 필요하다는 거예요.

expressions.example: Let me **break the ice** with a joke.
We don't always **see eye to eye**.
She gave me the cold shoulder.
I had to bite my tongue.

expressions.expression: let the cat out of the bag
expressions.example: Who **let the cat out of the bag**?
Don't **spill the beans** about the party.

expressions.expression: put one's foot in one's mouth
expressions.example: I really put my foot in my mouth.
His attitude gets on my nerves.

expressions.expression: give someone the benefit of the doubt
expressions.example: I'll give him the benefit of the doubt.
Don't **burn bridges** when you leave a job.
expressions.translation: 직장을 떠날 때 관계를 끊지 마세요.

expressions.expression: take it with a grain of salt
expressions.example: Take his advice with a grain of salt.
I'm still **on the fence** about it.

expressions.expression: between a rock and a hard place
expressions.example: I'm **between a rock and a hard place**.
I'm having second thoughts about moving.
I need to **weigh the pros and cons**.
I missed the boat on that opportunity.
Sometimes you just have to **go with the flow**.

expressions.expression: at the end of the day
expressions.example: **At the end of the day**, it's your decision.
**When push comes to shove**, I'll figure it out.
This is just the **tip of the iceberg**.
You need to **read between the lines**.
It turned out to be **a blessing in disguise**.
The test was a **piece of cake**.
I'm getting the hang of it.
She bent over backwards to help me.
expressions.translation: 그녀는 나를 돕기 위해 온갖 노력을 했어요.

expressions.example: I'll give it my best shot.
I have my hands full right now.

expressions.expression: bite off more than one can chew
expressions.example: I think I bit off more than I can chew.
expressions.translation: 감당 못할 일을 맡은 것 같아요.

expressions.example: I've been burning the midnight oil.

expressions.expression: keep one's eye on the ball
expressions.example: Keep your eye on the ball.
I need to get my act together.
**Hang in there**, you can do it.
Let me bring you **up to speed**.
You **have what it takes** to succeed.
You can do anything if you put your mind to it.
I decided to **take the plunge** and start my own business.
Eating out doesn't have to **break the bank**.
expressions.translation: 외식이 꼭 큰 돈을 쓸 필요는 없어요.

expressions.expression: cost an arm and a leg
expressions.example: This apartment costs an arm and a leg.
Jobs like that are **a dime a dozen**.
It's hard to **make ends meet** these days.
Many families **live from hand to mouth**.
expressions.translation: 많은 가족들이 그날 벌어 그날 먹어요.

expressions.example: We paid through the nose for parking.
I try to **put money aside** each month.

expressions.expression: get more bang for the buck
expressions.example: You get more bang for your buck here.
I'm saving for a rainy day.
We need to tighten our belts.
My grandmother is **as fit as a fiddle**.
Despite his age, he's **alive and kicking**.
I need to recharge my batteries.
He looked like he was **at death's door**.
The doctor told me to **take it easy**.
I think I'm coming down with a cold.
He finally kicked the smoking habit.
The doctor told me to stay off my feet.
The doctor gave me **a clean bill of health**.
I made friends at the party.
I fell out with my best friend.
I can't **put up with** this anymore.
I ran into an old friend.
She was brought up by her grandparents.
The teacher handed out the papers.
I came up with an idea.
I fell behind in my work.
I need to **catch up on** sleep.
I signed up for the class.
I need to **cut down on** sugar.
I need to **brush up on** my English.
It turned out to be true.
We made up after the fight.
I like to **wind down** with music.
It's hard for me to **open up**.
I dressed up for the party.
I checked in at the hotel.
I need to **clean up** my room.
I need to **stock up** on groceries.
I'm saving up for a car.
Can you talk me through it?
I can't get my point across.
Do I need to spell it out?
He talked me out of quitting.
